page.title: 09 VILLAGE LIFE-HAMPTON LUCY
page.content: Mr.Macloud has been running the village store in Hampton Lucy since 1948, when he inherited it from his father who started it at the beginning of the century. When he took over in 1948, ration coupons and bread units issued by the Ministry of Food were still in use. He now serves the local farms and nearby Charlecote with his delivery van. The mill was allowed to fall into disuse, but it is now in operation again, producing stone-ground wholemeal flour. The river attracts fishermen and artists along its banks. No village industry has survived, although a sand-blasting firm is based in the village. Recently a daily bus service to Stratford-on-Avon has been introduced.
